DOCNAME: CASE OF SAŠO GORGIEV v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant worked as a waiter in a bar in GPE . At TIME on DATE , PERSON , a police reservist , fired a shot in the bar hitting the applicant in the chest . According to a medical certificate of DATE issued by ORG , the applicant was urgently admitted in a “ serious condition ” ( тешка општа состојба ) . The injuries sustained were described as follows : broken right clavicle and CARDINAL broken ribs , injury to the subclavian artery , internal haemorrhaging and seizure of the brachial plexus nerves . His right arm was paralysed . The conclusion was that the applicant had sustained serious bodily injury with life - threatening damage and lasting consequences ( витална загрозеност и трајни последици ) . He was operated on twice , the second time in DATE in ORG of GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the trial court ” ) convicted PERSON in absentia of “ serious crimes against public security ” ( тешки дела против општата сигурност ) . He was sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . After the court had heard oral evidence from PERSON , the applicant and CARDINAL witnesses and examined other material evidence , it found that PERSON , while intoxicated , had unintentionally pulled the trigger of his service gun and shot the applicant , who had been at a distance of QUANTITY . The applicant was advised to pursue his compensation claim by means of a separate civil action . The decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . PERSON started serving his sentence on DATE . On DATE the trial court reopened the proceedings , at ORG request . On DATE the trial court found PERSON guilty again and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment , suspended for DATE . No information was provided as to whether that decision was the subject of an appeal or became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , represented by PERSON , brought a civil action against ORG ( “ the Ministry ” ) seeking compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary loss related to the injury sustained as a result of PERSON ’s action . He claimed that the ORG should be held responsible , given that PERSON , instead of being on duty in a police station , had shot him in the bar . He had used his service gun and had been in uniform . He claimed CARDINAL NORP denars ( ORG ) in respect of non - pecuniary damage and MKD CARDINAL,CARDINAL for pecuniary damage ( expenses related to his medical treatment ) .

CARDINAL . After CARDINAL adjournments , ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s claim on DATE , finding that the Ministry lacked the requisite capacity to be sued for the damage caused by PERSON , who , being a police reservist , was regarded a ORG official . The court established that TIME on DATE and TIME on DATE PERSON had been on duty in a police station in GPE . He had been assigned to stand guard ( службена задача DATE стража ) TIME and TIME on DATE . After TIME on DATE , instead of returning to the police station , PERSON had gone to the bar on his own initiative , without informing his superior or the latter ’s replacement . He had been in uniform and had been carrying his service gun . In the bar , in the presence of other customers and under the influence of alcohol , he had pulled the gun out and shot the applicant , who had been in front of him at a distance of QUANTITY . The court found that the applicant had suffered damage as a result of ORG ’s action . However , in order for ORG to be held responsible under section CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , the court said that

“ ... certain conditions need to be met : the damage must be caused by an official ( овластено службено лице ) , it must be sustained by a physical or legal person and , in particular , it has to be caused by an official in the performance of his or her duties . It also has to result from an unlawful action . The defendant ( the ORG ) will be held responsible only if the damage is caused in the course of or in connection with the performance of the official duties . An action will be regarded as carried out in the performance of a duty if it is part of the duties ( функција ) of the official . It is a a harmful action taken within TIME , in the official capacity of the person concerned and as part of his official duties . Damage may be caused outside official duties , but there must be a causal link with the performance of the duty or the duty itself ... in the present case , PERSON was not in the bar in an official capacity ... so the damage was not caused in connection with the performance of the Ministry ’s duties , even though it was caused at a time when PERSON was supposed to be on duty . At the critical time and place PERSON was not acting in an official capacity but as a private person , despite the fact that it was within TIME ; he was in uniform and used his service gun . PERSON is responsible for the action taken and damage caused . There is no causal link between his action and his duty ...

The fact that [ PERSON ] was in uniform and used his service gun does not mean , in itself , that he was acting in an official capacity . PERSON did not use the gun in connection with the performance of his duties , but as a customer in the bar ...

At the time when the damage occurred , PERSON , as a police reservist , was an adult and trained in the use of the gun . The defendant , as the owner of the gun , is relieved , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , from responsibility , given that the damage occurred solely as a result of an unforeseeable action by its agent whose consequences could neither have been prevented nor removed . ”
CARDINAL . The court concluded that the applicant remained entitled to claim compensation from ORG under LAW of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed , arguing that the ORG was to be held responsible for PERSON ’s actions , as he had acted while on duty , had been in uniform and had fired his service gun . In his submission , the ORG ’s responsibility derived from LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) under which ORG could claim reimbursement from PERSON , he submitted that he had suffered irreparable damage as a result of the incident , as his right arm had become permanently paralysed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal , finding no grounds on which to depart from the lower court ’s finding that PERSON ’s actions in the bar were not related to his official duties as a police officer . It went on to find that when PERSON shot the applicant he had not been acting as a police officer and had not been performing official duties . There was accordingly no responsibility on the part of ORG . The court confirmed the applicant ’s entitlement to claim compensation from PERSON

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) with ORG , arguing , inter alia , that ORG had not addressed his arguments regarding the ORG ’s responsibility under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law , reiterating the reasons given by the lower courts .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW sets out the general principle governing civil compensation claims .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that the employer is responsible for damage caused by an employee in the performance of his or her duties or in relation to these . The victim can claim compensation directly from the employee if the damage was caused intentionally . The employer can seek reimbursement of the compensation awarded to the victim from the employee if the latter caused the damage intentionally or negligently .
CARDINAL . Under CARDINAL , the owner of a dangerous item ( опасен предмет ) is responsible for any damage caused by it .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that the owner of a dangerous item can be relieved of responsibility if it can be shown that the damage was caused exclusively by an unforeseeable action on the part of the victim or a third person whose consequences could not have been prevented or removed .

CARDINAL . NORP Under LAW of DATE , as in force at that time , an employer was responsible for any damage caused by an employee while performing his or her duties or in relation to them . The employer could seek reimbursement of the compensation from the employee if the latter had caused the damage intentionally or negligently .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW , as in force at the time , specified which agents were regarded as ORG officials .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , ORG officials were required to perform their duties at all times , regardless as to whether they were on or off duty .

CARDINAL . In a state of war or emergency , the ORG could call up reservists in order to ensure public safety and prevent mass disorder ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ) . Reservists could be recruited for training or practice . During their period of service , reservists were regarded as ORG officials within the meaning of LAW ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The Government provided a copy of a first - instance court decision concerning a compensation claim submitted against the ORG and a police officer who had negligently fired his service gun inside the NORP building , as a result of which the claimant sustained bodily injuries . The first - instance court found the police officer directly responsible and ordered him to pay the damages . It dismissed the claim against ORG on grounds of lack of capacity to be sued . No information was provided as to whether this decision became final ( П.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . The police officer in this case was convicted of “ serious crimes against public security ” and sentenced to a suspended prison term ( К.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) .
CARDINAL . LAW provides , inter alia , that :
“ Rules and regulations on the use of firearms by law enforcement officials should include guidelines that :
( a ) Specify the circumstances under which law enforcement officials are authorised to carry firearms ...
( b ) Ensure that firearms are used only in appropriate circumstances and in a manner likely to decrease the risk of unnecessary harm ;
( d ) Regulate the control , storage and issuing of firearms , including procedures for ensuring that law enforcement officials are accountable for the firearms and ammunition issued to them . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW provides that “ the police may use force only when strictly necessary and only to the extent required to obtain a legitimate objective ” .
CARDINAL . The commentary to LAW reads , inter alia , as follows :
“ ... The importance of recruitment of suitable personnel to the police , as well as their training can not be underestimated ... ”
